intro: Tecomaria fulva, commonly known as the yellow flame tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking orange to yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has compound leaves with opposite arrangement and produces woody capsules as fruit. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental plant in tropical and subtropical regions. Its rapid growth and showy flowers make it a valuable addition to gardens and landscapes.
